w:r.w:t: This document outlines the requirements for implementing a flexible, multi-tiered pricing system with eco-admin level controls and instance-level overrides for the Inspect360.ai platform.
Eco-admin must be able to define pricing in multiple currencies based on customer registration location.
Store all base pricing in a master currency (suggest GBP) with conversion rates
Allow eco-admin to set and update conversion rates or integrate with live currency API
Define standard subscription tiers with included inspection quotas.
Each tier record should support multi-currency pricing via related
Define add-on packs with tiered pricing based on subscription level.
Define pricing for fire assessments and other extensive inspections (800+ images).
Define available premium modules with pricing and enable/disable functionality at eco-admin level.
(White Labelling, Tenant Portal, Maintenance & Work Orders, AI Preventative Maintenance, Dispute Resolution Portal)
Define module bundles with discounted pricing.
Edit tier details (name, included inspections, pricing in all active currencies)
Set tiered pricing matrix (pack × tier × currency)
Set pricing for all active currencies
Configure usage limits and overage pricing
View complete pricing structure as it will appear to customers
Each customer instance needs to store subscription details and allow overrides.
(nullable decimal - if set, overrides tier pricing)
Visual slider that automatically adjusts pricing based on selected inspection quantity and shows current tier.
many inspections do you need per month? │
Range: 10 to 500+ inspections (with "500+" triggering custom quote)
// If multiple tiers qualify, select the most cost-effective
// If count > 500, flag for Enterprise Plus custom pricing
When inspections exceed tier quota, calculate needed add-ons
Always recommend the most cost-effective pack combination
needed, show "10 inspections at Professional rate" vs suggesting 20-pack
If user selects inspection count close to next tier boundary
Calculate if upgrading tier is more cost-effective than buying add-ons
// Check if next tier is better value
Allow customers to purchase additional inspection packs based on their current tier.
Prevent purchase if would exceed practical limits
Turn modules on/off at instance level during subscription setup and ongoing management.
table (if customer subscribes to a bundle):
// Check 1: Is module globally enabled at eco-admin level?
// Check 2: Is module enabled for this instance?
│ Self-service portal for up to 500 tenants │
│ Track and manage repairs and contractors │
Show current usage for modules with limits
Allow admin users to override monthly fee, annual fee, and per-module fees at the instance level for custom deals.
table with override fields (already mentioned in 2.1)
Send notification to finance team when overrides are applied
Display warning if override creates negative margin
// 2. Fall back to standard tier pricing in instance currency
// 2. Check if part of active bundle (bundle price takes precedence)
return 0; // Module cost covered by bundle
// 3. Fall back to standard module pricing
Base subscription tier (with overrides if applicable)
100% of quota reached (prompt to buy add-on)
Average inspections per customer by tier
"message": "Tenant Portal enabled. Prorated charge of £59.50 will be added to next invoice."
Create and edit pricing across multiple currencies
Update tier pricing and verify propagation
Create bundles and verify discount calculations
Verify tier detection at boundary values
Verify override takes precedence over standard pricing
Verify bundle members show as included (£0 additional)
Disable module mid-cycle and verify proration
Verify only authorized users can set overrides
Check instance users cannot see override settings
Tabbed interface: Tiers | Add-Ons | Extensive | Modules | Bundles
Bulk edit capability for multi-currency pricing
Annual vs monthly toggle with savings display
AI-driven pricing recommendations based on usage patterns
Should currency conversion rates be manually set or integrated with a live API (e.g., exchangeratesapi.io)?
When a customer changes their subscription mid-cycle, should we prorate daily or monthly?
Should add-on inspection packs expire after a certain period (e.g., 12 months) or roll over indefinitely?
Do pricing overrides above a certain threshold require approval from senior management before activation?
Should module overage charges be billed monthly or accumulated and billed at renewal?
When modules are enabled mid-cycle, should the prorated charge be:
Since this tier requires custom pricing, should it be hidden from the slider and only accessible through sales team contact?
What's the grace period before subscription suspension due to failed payment?
